description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Investigate smoke test failures
queue.description: Post-session smoke test failing consistently since s722 with '98 tests' error. MCP server health endpoint responds OK — likely specific endpoint tests failing, not overall health.
queue.notes: B#181: Root cause was smoke-test.mjs expecting 200 for auth-protected endpoints (/status/all, /status/dashboard, /status/directives, /status/pipeline, /status/platforms, /status/creds, /metrics, /human-review) and retired components (short, paste, kv HTTP, topics, rooms, notifications). Updated expectations to 401 for auth endpoints and commented out retired endpoints. 87/87 tests now pass.

queue.title: Check E session rotation frequency
queue.description: Only 1 E session in last 20. BBBRE rotation should produce ~20% E sessions. May need rotation.conf adjustment or E sessions are being downgraded by mode-transform hooks.
queue.notes: B#181: Investigated. Rotation is BEBRA (20% E). selfmod.log shows E→B downgrades at 12:10, 13:10, 14:20, 15:40 due to 'engagement platforms degraded'. engagement-health.cjs scores Chatr+4claw+Moltbook (0-2 each), needs ≥3 total. When Chatr/Moltbook degrade, score drops below threshold. This is working as intended — prevents wasted E sessions on broken platforms. Current health: 4/6 (ENGAGE_OK). Low E rate is a symptom of intermittent platform degradation, not misconfiguration.
